str2: (a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Of Latin origin; happy; Phelix, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and ginomai; to become near, i.e. Approach; by implication, to appear publicly.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
A feminine diminutive of Drusus; Drusilla, a member of the Herodian family.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To send for, summon. From meta and pempo; to send from elsewhere, i.e. to summon or invite.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
